lines.content: Volkov is a command-line task manager that allows you to add 3 different types of tasks,
set their relevant dates, and track your progress on the tasks with simple commands.
Your tasks are saved automatically, allowing you to revisit whenever you need to.
Adds a todo task for Volkov to remember.
Roger. Task has been added to the list:
You now have 1 tasks in the list.
Adds a deadline task for Volkov to remember.
Roger. Task has been added to the list:
You now have 2 tasks in the list.
Adds an event task for Volkov to remember.
Roger. Task has been added to the list:
You now have 3 tasks in the list.
Marks a task as completed in Volkov's task list.
Roger. This task has been marked as done:
Marks a task as uncompleted in Volkov's task list.
Roger. This task has been marked as not done yet:
Removes a task from Volkov's task list.
You now have 2 tasks in the list.
Lists all tasks in Volkov's task list.
These are all the tasks in your list:
Finds the tasks in Volkov's task list that match the query
These are the tasks that match you search query:
Saves the task list on the hard disk and closes the program
See you again soon! Service terminated.
* Represents the command to exit the program
* Executes the exit command by displaying a farewell message to the user.
* @param tasks   The {@code TaskList} containing all tasks.
* @param ui      The {@code Ui} for user interaction.
* @param storage The {@code Storage} for file operations.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
new Ui().formatResponse("     See you again soon! Service terminated.");
* Returns boolean true to indicate the exiting of the program
* Represents an abstract command to be executed in the main body.
* Subclasses of {@code Commands} implements methods with specific behavior
* Executes the command with the task list, user interface, and storage.
* Exact implementations depends on the relevant command.
* @param tasks   The {@code TaskList} containing all tasks.
* @param ui      The {@code Ui} object handling user interactions.
* @param storage The {@code Storage} object for file operations.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {}
* Determines whether this command is an exit command.
* Defaults to {@code false}, and only exit commands
* would override this method to return {@code true}.
* @return {@code true} if the command should terminate the program, otherwise {@code false}.
* Represents a deadline task with a description, completion status, and deadline date.
* The {@code Deadline} class provides methods to mark the task as done,
* unmark it, retrieve its status, and formatting for displaying or saving.
* This method is inherited from {@link Task}.
* @return A string representation of the task, its description, and deadline date
* This method is inherited from {@link Task}.
* @return A formatted string representing the task.
* Represents the command to add a deadline task
* The {@code DeadlineCommand} creates a new {@code Deadline} task
* with a specified description and a deadline date,
* and adds it to the {@code TaskList}.
* Executes the deadline command by creating a {@code Deadline} object,
* adds it to the taskList and displays a confirmation message.
* @param tasks   The {@code TaskList} containing all tasks.
* @param ui      The {@code Ui} for user interaction.
* @param storage The {@code Storage} for file operations.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Represents the command to delete a task based on its taskNo from the tasklist
* Executes the delete command by removing the specified task from the task list.
* Displays a confirmation message when successfully deleted.
* If the task number is invalid, an error message is displayed instead.
* @param tasks   The {@code TaskList} containing all tasks.
* @param ui      The {@code Ui} for user interaction.
* @param storage The {@code Storage} for file operations.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
String reply = "     Roger. Task has been removed:\n"
+ "     You now have " + (tasks.size()-1) + " tasks in the list.";
String reply = "     Task number not found, reenter with correct task number:";
String reply = "     No task number detected, reenter with correct task number:";
* Represents an event task with a description, completion status, and start and end dates.
* The {@code Event} class provides methods to mark the task as done,
* unmark it, retrieve its status, and formatting for displaying or saving.
public Event(String description, String startDate, String endDate) {

* Represents the command to add an event task.
* The {@code EventCommand} creates a new {@code Event} task with
* a specified description and a start and end date,
* and adds it to the {@code TaskList}.
EventCommand(String taskDesc, String startDate, String endDate) {

* @param storage The {@code Storage} for file operations.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
Event t = new Event(taskDesc, startDate, endDate);
* Represents the command to search for tasks
* The {@code FindCommand} finds the task the user wishes to search for in the {@code TaskList}.
* Executes the command by iterating through and printing every task in the {@code TaskList}
* @param tasks   The {@code TaskList} containing all tasks.
* @param ui      The {@code Ui} for user interaction.
* @param storage The {@code Storage} for file operations.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
sb.append("     These are the tasks that match you search query:");
* Represents the command to list all tasks in the task list.
* The {@code ListCommand} retrieves and displays all tasks currently stored in the {@code TaskList}.
* Executes the command by iterating through and printing every task in the {@code TaskList}.
* @param tasks   The {@code TaskList} containing all tasks.
* @param ui      The {@code Ui} for user interaction.
* @param storage The {@code Storage} for file operations.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
sb.append("     These are all the tasks in your list:");
* Represents the command to mark a task as done.
* The {@code MarkCommand} updates the specified task number's
* task's status as done and displays a confirmation message to the user.
* Executes the command by marking the specified task as done.
* Displays a confirmation message when successful, or an error
* message if the task number is invalid.
* @param tasks   The {@code TaskList} containing all tasks.
* @param ui      The {@code Ui} for user interaction.
* @param storage The {@code Storage} for file operations.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {

* Represents a command for handling unrecognized or incomplete commands.
* The {@code MissingCommand} is used when a user enters an invalid command
* or lacks relevant parameters. It then displays an error message to
* guide the user in correcting this.
* Executes the command by displaying the provided error message to the user.
* @param tasks   The {@code TaskList} containing all tasks.
* @param ui      The {@code Ui} for user interaction.
* @param storage The {@code Storage} for file operations.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* The {@code Parser} class deals with making sense of the user command,
* then maps it to the respective commands.
* Parses the given user input and returns the corresponding command.
* This method identifies the relevant command by checking the input string
* against predetermined command keywords and extracts the respective necessary
* parameters, using which to return an appropriate {@code Commands} object.
* @param input The user input to parse.
* @return A {@code Commands} object representing the parsed command.
throw new MissingDescription("MISSING DESCRIPTION, reenter with description");
return new MissingCommand("    " + "MISSING DESCRIPTION, reenter with description");
throw new MissingDescription("MISSING DESCRIPTION, reenter with description");
throw new MissingDescription("MISSING DEADLINE, reenter with deadline");
return new MissingCommand("    " + "MISSING DESCRIPTION, reenter with description");
throw new MissingDescription("MISSING DESCRIPTION, reenter with description");
throw new MissingDescription("MISSING DESCRIPTION, reenter with description");
throw new MissingDescription("MISSING DESCRIPTION, reenter with description");
return new MissingCommand("    " + "MISSING DESCRIPTION, reenter with description");
return new MissingCommand("Unknown command received, reenter command:");
* The {@code Storage} class deals with the loading
* and saving of tasks in a local txt file.
* Saves the current list of tasks to a txt file.
* If the file or directory does not exist, it will be created first.
* Tasks are saved in a format to ease the load process
* @param taskList The list of tasks to be saved.
ui.formatResponse("     Folder missing, new folder created");
ui.formatResponse("     No file present, new file created");
* Attempts to load tasks from the txt file into a new {@code TaskList}.
* If the file exists, it greets the user  as a returning user,
* reads, parses and loads the tasks from the txt file to a new {@code TaskList}
* which then gets returned. Otherwise, it greets the user as a new user
* @return A {@code TaskList} containing the loaded tasks.
Task t = new Event(desc, start, end);
* Represents a generic task with a description and completion status.
* The {@code Task} class provides methods to mark the task as done,
* unmark it, retrieve its status, and formatting for displaying or saving.
* Returns the string formatting that represents the completion status of the task.
* @return A string "[X] " if the task is done, "[ ] " if not.
* Returns the string formatting used for saving of the task's information
* @return A string representation of the task and its information
* Returns a string representation of the task,
* including its type, completion status and description.
* @return A formatted string representing the task.
* The {@code TaskList} class provides methods to add, remove, retrieve,
* and access the number of tasks stored in an {@code ArrayList}.
private static final ArrayList<Task> listOfTasks = new ArrayList<>();
* Represents a todo task with a description and completion status.
* The {@code Todo} class provides methods to mark the task as done,
* unmark it, retrieve its status, and formatting for displaying or saving.
* This method is inherited from {@link Task}.
* @return A string representation of the task and its description
* This method is inherited from {@link Task}.
* @return A formatted string representing the task.
* Represents a command to add a new to-do task.
* The {@code TodoCommand} creates a new to-do task with a specified description
* and adds it to the task list.
* Executes the command by creating a new {@code Todo} object,
* adds it to the task list, and displays a confirmation message.
* @param tasks   The {@code TaskList} containing all tasks.
* @param ui      The {@code Ui} for user interaction.
* @param storage The {@code Storage} for file operations.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* The {@code Ui} class deals with interactions with the
* user by handling the formatting of responses,
* reading user input, and displaying greeting messages.

+ "     What can I do for you?\n"
